TYRANTS.Definition: cruel rulers who used power unfairly

HIJACKINGS.Definition: taking control of vehicles, like planes or ships, by force

BUSHMAN.Definition: a member of an Indigenous group from southern Africa

HUNTER-GATHERER.Definition: early people who hunted animals and collected plants for food

STATISTICIANS.Definition: people who study and use numbers to understand information

YARDSTICK.Definition: something used to measure or compare things

FLEETING.Definition: lasting for only a short time

VIRTUOUS.Definition: good and moral, doing the right thing

SUBJECTIVE.Definition: based on personal feelings or opinions

CATCH-ALL TERM.Definition: a word that includes many different things

PERCEPTION.Definition: how you see or understand it

CAVEMAN.Definition: prehistoric man who lived in caves

THEORETICALLY.Definition: in a way that works in theory, but not always in real life

EQUATION.Definition: a mathematical statement that showed two things were equal

SUBTRACTING.Definition: taking one away from the other to calculate the difference

FECUNDITY.Definition: the ability to produce more of something, fruitfulness

STANDALONE.Definition: separate, not part of something else

STUBBING.Definition: hitting it against something by accident

CALCULUS.Definition: a system or method of calculating it

IMPRACTICAL.Definition: not easy or possible to do in real life

SCALES.Definition: systems for measuring or comparing it

PINGING.Definition: sending a short sound or message to get attention

BEEPER.Definition: a small device that made a sound to send messages

ABSORBED.Definition: fully focused on or interested in

COMMUTER.Definition: a person who travels to and from work each day

HORMONE.Definition: a chemical in the body that controls how it works or feels

INVASIVE.Definition: involving going into someoneâ€™s body or private life

TONE.Definition: the feeling or mood in them

SALIVA.Definition: the liquid in your mouth, spit

TRENDS.Definition: general directions in which things change or develop

RELIABLY.Definition: in a consistently good or accurate way

LOAF.Definition: a single large piece of it

WELLBEING.Definition: a state of being healthy and happy

RUCKSACK.Definition: a bag carried on the back

TRAM.Definition: an electric vehicle that runs on tracks

CORE.Definition: the main or most important part

TREND.Definition: a pattern or change that continues over time

DEED.Definition: an action, especially something kind or brave

RANKED.Definition: given a position on a list based on quality or level
